Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2009 08:13AM nurseloo wrote: Hi all.  I had my bilateral on 1/21 and left hospital on 1/22, came home on 1/23 (3 hour drive).  Considering all things, I am doing great.  I still have to take the vicodin, and yesterday added a muscle relaxer because I am having muscle spasms around the drains.  Two were removed yesterday, and I still have two left, but I am up walking around a lot, and doing fairly well.  Tissue expanders seem to be causing some discomfort as well, but you don't go through something like this without some pain.  My final path report showed no node involvement, surgical margins were clear, and the original invasive ductal carcinoma seems to be gone.  DCIS still present, but I am blown away that the invasive ductal was absent from the final path.  So, back to both surgeons on Monday and I guess that I will find out about chemo then, and hopefully, get these last two drainage tubes removed.  I feel blessed with the final path, and we'll see what an oncologist does with that.  Thanks to everyone for sharing what's going on with you, it helps me to see what others feel and experience.

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2008 06:09AM nurseloo wrote: KLFH- I too am scheduled for a bilateral with implants on 1/21.  I talk to the PS on 1/5 and am guessing these will be tissue expanders.  My lesion is small, but high grade, and my receptors are negative except for the HER-2.  This is probably overkill, but many of my friends and patients have told me that if they had to do it over, they would also do bilaterals.  And, I am 57, and don't ever want to walk this road again.  I feel certain that I'll have to do chemo and radiation post, so we may walk this road together somewhat.
